item.title: Bessent believes there won't be a recession in 2026 but says some sectors are challenged
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the U.S. was not at risk of entering a recession in 2026 and that Americans would soon benefit from Trump's poli...

item.title: Fed won't get key inflation data before next rate decision as BLS cancels October CPI release
item.description: The BLS said it was canceling the release of the October CPI, leaving the Fed without a key piece of inflation data before it next decides on interest...

item.title: Cleveland Fed's Hammack supports keeping rates around current 'barely restrictive' level
item.description: Hammack on Thursday gave indications that she thinks the central bank could be nearing the end of what could be a brief rate-cutting cycle.

item.title: Delayed September report shows U.S. added 119,000 jobs, more than expected; unemployment rate at 4.4%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to add 50,000 in September, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: The September jobs report is finally coming out Thursday. Here's what it is expected to show
item.description: Due at 8:30 a.m. ET, the report is forecast to show a gain of 50,000 jobs in the public and private sectors.
